page.title: 19PREVIOUS DOMESDAY REFERENCE.
page.content: During 1066 when the original domesday book was drawn up there was no entry for Wheaton Aston in its own name.There is however reference made to Lapley and it reads as follows: Â£The Church at St.Renny at Lapley (3 hides) was held by T.R.E.by the church from the King and still is. There are 3 ploughs and 5 serfs in demense.The 18 villeins and 9 borders have 8 ploughs.There are 16 acres of meadow and woodland 3 furlongs long and 3 furlongs wide.It is valued at 50s. Although Wheaton Aston is not mentioned the reference to 18 villeins and 9 small holdings suggests a larger settlement than Lapley would be on it's own.
